OK, I've spoken in my defense, lets get back to the fight :)

BIC- Branded knew that the Cybrats were badly outclassed this time, she
opened a link to Switchblade, "We're getting our mudflaps handed to us down
here, Doggeds hurt bad and I've lost a flamethrower" the status report was
poorly timed, especially since the Cybrats were so badly unorganized if
things didn't work out perfectly. The report was broadcast over a basic
frequency, the Cybrats lack of military knowhow would one day prove fatal.
(Which it did in the other RPG I used them in.) The firebot switched her
weapon to burst to conserve fuel.  She stuck her head out from the debris
she was hiding behind and fired five heat bursts toward Swoop and  Artemis.
If she could get some pressure off the others there would still be a (slim)
chance of success.



----- Original Message -----
From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 31, 2001 7:53 AM
Subject: Re: The bum and the hole...


> OOC: Well I just need to ad my opinion, I think the rule of interception
> is pretty useless, and poorly thought out. IMH it is much more
> interesting sometimes to intercept than to just dodge when you think you
> dont want to accept dammage. And Jeff, in the show they did intercept,
> ussually missiles with gun fire, but sometimes more powerful rays
> against each other. Megatron and Dinobots laser war from Double Dinobot
> comes to mind. In the original series, Slag even ignited a missile with
> his flame breath before it reached him, and I'm not sure, but I think
> Inferno did it too.
>
